nodes.description: Changes that can be reversed to obtain the original material.
Changes that cannot be reversed to obtain the original material.
Cooking food, such as a roti, on a tawa resulting in irreversible changes.
An example of irreversible change where a balloon cannot return to its original shape after bursting.
An example of reversible change where paper can be unfolded to its original form.
An example of reversible change where dough can be reshaped into a ball after being rolled out.
